page.title: 01DISTINGTON-AN INTRODUCTION
page.content: {DISTINGTON The area as a whole is comprised of mainly farmland with scattered farms,an industrial estate,two villages opencast mine workings and disused railways.Features of interest outside the main village of Distington include a ruined castle-though little of it remains,a stone circle,thought to be associated with the Celtic God Diss,from whos name Distington derives. Our survey has covered the people of Distington village,a typical day in their lives-the doctor, vicar policeman,farmers and their wives,and garage mechanics.We have visited the schools factories and other places of work.Our survey includes the children's most popular TV programmes and spare time interests.
